definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)
human trafficking/to abduct and sell/to kidnap and sell
to knock sb out with a drug/to render sb unconscious
lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
lit. the soul of a deceased has not yet dispersed (idiom)/fig. the influence still lingers on/the spirit (of some doctrine) is still alive
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to bind a person's upper body, with arms tied behind the back and rope looped around the neck/to truss up
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
villains collude together (idiom); to work hand in glove with sb (to nefarious ends)
